items.title: Atl√©tico-icoon Koke kan tegen Real Madrid bijzonder derby-record op naam zetten
items.summary: Atl√©tico Madrid-aanvoerder Koke staat op het punt om Spaanse voetbalgeschiedenis te schrijven. De middenvelder kan donderdagavond de speler met de meeste Madrileense derby's achter zijn naam worden. Koke deelt dat record momenteel met Real Madrid-icoon Sergio Ramos. Hij houdt zich er naar eigen zeggen niet zo mee bezig.

items.title: Burnley v Manchester United: Premier League ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Premier League updates from the 8.15pm GMT kick-off ‚öΩ Live scores | Table | Follow us on Bluesky | Email Daniel Ruben Amorim was, by any metric, an absolute disaster at Old Trafford. In the Premier-League era, no United manager has achieved fewer points per game, nor a finish as low as 15th-place; looking further back, no United manager since Frank O‚ÄôFarrell, in 1972, lost as high a percentage of games; and every other United manager in history avoided the eternal stain of losing a cup final to Tottenham Hotspur, never mind Ange Postecoglou‚Äôs Tottenham Hotspur. Life, though, is rarely as simple as mate, your precious 3-4-2-1 is a piece of nonsense, and Amorim leaves United in a state far better than the one in which he found them. After Brighton were beaten earlier in the season, Danny Welbeck reported teammates lauding the best opponent they‚Äôd faced in a while, while the football played in the 4-4 draw with Bournemouth was both promising and exhilarating. And, though it‚Äôs impossible to argue against the sacking ‚Äì even if its trigger was criticising bosses with even more miserable track records ‚Äì Amorim was ultimately stymied by bad luck. Had the absences of key players not coincided with injuries to key players, he‚Äôd still be in a job ‚Äì perhaps even thriving. Continue reading...

items.title: Kevin Keegan, former England and Newcastle manager, diagnosed with cancer
items.summary: He was admitted to hospital with abdominal symptoms Keegan, 74, ‚Äògrateful for intervention and ongoing care‚Äô The former England and Newcastle manager Kevin Keegan has been diagnosed with cancer. The 74-year-old was recently admitted to hospital after presenting abdominal symptoms and tests have shown he has the disease for which he will undergo treatment. Continue reading...
